definition:
The Vandermonde approach for interpolation is when we wish to determine
the interpolating polynomial $p(x)=a_0 + a_1x + a_2x^2 + \ldots +a_nx^n$
for the $n+1$ points $(x_i,y_i)$, $i=0,1,\ldots, n$ by forming the
equations $y_i=a_0+a_1x_i+a_2x_2^2+\ldots+a_nx_n^n$ for
$i = 0,1,\ldots,n$, and solving for the unknown coefficients
$a_0, a_1,\ldots, a_n$.

The system of equations can be written by using matrices $Y=XA$ where
$X$ is a Vandermonde matrix.
